intro: Tritonia dubia, commonly known as the slender white violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Tritonia dubia thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
